trans-unit.source: Submit a work item to the thread pool
trans-unit.target: Submit a work item to the thread pool

trans-unit.source: Learn how to do work in a separate thread by submitting a work item to the thread pool.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to do work in a separate thread by submitting a work item to the thread pool.

trans-unit.source: Submit a work item to the thread pool
trans-unit.target: Submit a work item to the thread pool

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: RunAsync
trans-unit.target: RunAsync

trans-unit.source: IAsyncAction
trans-unit.target: IAsyncAction

trans-unit.source: Learn how to do work in a separate thread by submitting a work item to the thread pool.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to do work in a separate thread by submitting a work item to the thread pool.

trans-unit.source: Use this to maintain a responsive UI while still completing work that takes a noticeable amount of time, and use it to complete multiple tasks in parallel.
trans-unit.target: Use this to maintain a responsive UI while still completing work that takes a noticeable amount of time, and use it to complete multiple tasks in parallel.

trans-unit.source: Create and submit the work item
trans-unit.target: Create and submit the work item

trans-unit.source: Create a work item by calling [**RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230593).
trans-unit.target: Create a work item by calling [**RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230593).

trans-unit.source: Supply a delegate to do the work (you can use a lambda, or a delegate function).
trans-unit.target: Supply a delegate to do the work (you can use a lambda, or a delegate function).

trans-unit.source: Note that **RunAsync** returns an [**IAsyncAction**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206580) object; store this object for use in the next step.
trans-unit.target: Note that **RunAsync** returns an [**IAsyncAction**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206580) object; store this object for use in the next step.

trans-unit.source: Three versions of [**RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230593) are available so that you can optionally specify the priority of the work item, and control whether it runs concurrently with other work items.
trans-unit.target: Three versions of [**RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230593) are available so that you can optionally specify the priority of the work item, and control whether it runs concurrently with other work items.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to access the UI thread and show progress from the work item.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to access the UI thread and show progress from the work item.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a work item and supplies a lambda to do the work:
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a work item and supplies a lambda to do the work:

trans-unit.source: Following the call to [**RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230593), the work item is queued by the thread pool and runs when a thread becomes available.
trans-unit.target: Following the call to [**RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230593), the work item is queued by the thread pool and runs when a thread becomes available.

trans-unit.source: Thread pool work items run asynchronously and they can run in any order, so make sure your work items function independently.
trans-unit.target: Thread pool work items run asynchronously and they can run in any order, so make sure your work items function independently.

trans-unit.source: Note that the work item checks the [**IAsyncInfo.Status**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206593) property, and exits if the work item is cancelled.
trans-unit.target: Note that the work item checks the [**IAsyncInfo.Status**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR206593) property, and exits if the work item is cancelled.

trans-unit.source: Handle work item completion
trans-unit.target: Handle work item completion

trans-unit.source: Provide a completion handler by setting the [**IAsyncAction.Completed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.foundation.iasyncaction.completed.aspx) property of the work item.
trans-unit.target: Provide a completion handler by setting the [**IAsyncAction.Completed**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.foundation.iasyncaction.completed.aspx) property of the work item.

trans-unit.source: Supply a delegate (you can use a lambda or a delegate function) to handle work item completion.
trans-unit.target: Supply a delegate (you can use a lambda or a delegate function) to handle work item completion.

trans-unit.source: For example, use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to access the UI thread and show the result.
trans-unit.target: For example, use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to access the UI thread and show the result.

trans-unit.source: The following example updates the UI with the result of the work item submitted in step 1:
trans-unit.target: The following example updates the UI with the result of the work item submitted in step 1:

trans-unit.source: Note that the completion handler checks whether the work item was cancelled before dispatching a UI update.
trans-unit.target: Note that the completion handler checks whether the work item was cancelled before dispatching a UI update.

trans-unit.source: Summary and next steps
trans-unit.target: Summary and next steps

trans-unit.source: You can learn more by downloading the code from this quickstart in the [Creating a ThreadPool work item sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=328569) written for Windows 8.1, and re-using the source code in a win\_unap Windows 10 app.
trans-unit.target: You can learn more by downloading the code from this quickstart in the [Creating a ThreadPool work item sample](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=328569) written for Windows 8.1, and re-using the source code in a win\_unap Windows 10 app.
